sentences.en: A literary composition in the form of a soliloquy.
sentences.cn: 一种文体,通过长长的独白展现人物的思想和感情.

sentences.en: As he made this dreary soliloquy, he had cantered out of Rotten Row into the park.
sentences.cn: 他一边这么闷闷不乐地自言自语,一边离开了罗登道,来到公园里.

sentences.en: Generally, operas start with a soliloquy of an actor introducing himself on his first appearance.
sentences.cn: 通常戏的开头都会有几句定场白.

sentences.en: Hamlet's soliloquy is probably the most famous in English drama.
sentences.cn: 哈姆雷特的独白在英国戏剧中大概是最出名的了.

sentences.en: Such expressions in literary works are called as soliloquy.
sentences.cn: 这种现象在文学作品中的表现就是独白.

sentences.en: The soliloquy was an Elizabethan dramatic convention.
sentences.cn: 独白是伊丽莎白时代戏剧的惯常手法.

trans.tran_cn: 自言自语，（戏剧中的）独白
trans.tran_en: a speech in a play in which a character, usually alone on the stage, talks to himself or herself so that the  audience  knows their thoughts
